definition: Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]

sentences.english: Without Ceres and Bacchus, Venus grows cold.
sentences.chinese: 离开克瑞斯和巴克斯，维纳斯便心灰意冷。

sentences.english: But they are not reason to despair about the future.
sentences.chinese: 但不能因为这些原因而对未来心灰意冷。

sentences.english: The Bai Ren with heart grey cold meaning encounters accident one after another.
sentences.chinese: 心灰意冷的伯仁接连遭遇不测。

sentences.english: Agencies say, Heartbroken, the burden back to the shop up to go home.
sentences.chinese: 秀才一听，心灰意冷，回店收拾包袱准备回家。

sentences.english: Lin Fei is disheartened over her terminal disease and contemplates suicide.
sentences.chinese: 林菲身患绝症，心灰意冷，竟萌起自杀念头。

sentences.english: Dejected wife descendants dream rain, will also remain down?
sentences.chinese: 心灰意冷的妻子孙梦雨，还会留下来吗？

sentences.english: He again downhearted, in the heart of hate in the world.
sentences.chinese: 他再次心灰意冷，在心里恨着这个世界。

sentences.english: But the reality of these formidable challenges should not dishearten us.
sentences.chinese: 但是，这些巨大挑战的现实不应使我们心灰意冷。

sentences.english: When I first heard the language spoken from a recorder in class, i was really disappointed.
sentences.chinese: 第一次在大学课堂上通过录音机听中文，我心灰意冷。

sentences.english: It frustrated me because I wanted to answer "just give me a chance".
sentences.chinese: 这使我心灰意冷，我只想说“就给我一次机会”。

sentences.english: The old-basket maker went home, disheartened.
sentences.chinese: 老篮制造商心灰意冷地往家走。

sentences.english: A scholar, disheartened, returned home ready to pack up shop.
sentences.chinese: 秀才一听，心灰意冷，回店收拾包袱准备回家。

sentences.english: He became insular, emotionally dead, passionless and morose.
sentences.chinese: 菲的死让明变得孤僻，他心灰意冷，郁郁寡欢。

definition: every hope turns to dust (idiom); completely disheartened
lit. people rebelling and friends deserting (idiom)/fig. to find oneself utterly isolated
one stumble, unable to rise (idiom); a setback leading to total collapse/ruined at a stroke/unable to recover after a minor hitch
not knowing what to do next/at a loose end
to despair/to give up all hope/desperate/desperation

nothing sadder than a withered heart (idiom attributed to Confucius by Zhuangzi 莊子|庄子[Zhuang1 zi3])/no greater sorrow than a heart that never rejoices/the worst sorrow is not as bad as an uncaring heart/nothing is more wretched than apathy
pinyin: ai1 mo4 da4 yu2 xin1 si3
